title: Crossing the river with a boat

content.question: A person wants to paddle a canoe from point <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is directly across a river from point <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. The water in the river flows at <math alttext="5 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the person can paddle the canoe at <math alttext="10 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in still water. Which of the following vectors best represents the appropriate heading for the canoe if it is to land at point <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows an arrow pointing steeply upward and to the right.
The figure shows an arrow pointing slightly downward and to the right.
The figure shows an arrow pointing steeply downward and to the right.
The figure shows an arrow pointing slightly upward and to the left.
The figure shows an arrow pointing steeply upward and to the left.

content.answer: The figure shows an arrow pointing steeply upward and to the left.
